intro: Lantana machadoi, commonly known as the Madagascan lantana, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the verbena family (Verbenaceae) and is characterized by its vibrant clusters of small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, blooming in summer, and it produces small, dry fruits containing numerous seeds. Lantana machadoi is adapted to dry, sunny environments and is often found in coastal and inland areas of its native habitat.
